meanings.definition: Having greater value or merit than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The shiny new bike looked worthier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: She believed her handmade gift was worthier than any store-bought present.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy thought the big dog's bone looked worthier and tried to steal it.
meanings.sent4: The rare diamond was worthier than all the other gems in the collection.
meanings.sent5: The golden crown sparkled, making it look worthier than any other crown in the kingdom.

meanings.definition: More deserving of respect or admiration.
meanings.sent1: The brave firefighter was considered worthier than anyone else in the town.
meanings.sent2: Her selfless actions made her worthier of praise than anyone at the event.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten thought it was worthier of attention than the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The wise elder was worthier of listening to than the young speaker.
meanings.sent5: The stunning artwork left everyone in awe, proving it was worthier of admiration than any other piece.
